23#include <QtCore/QElapsedTimer>
24#include <QtCore/QThread>
25#include <QtCore/QByteArray>
26#include <QtCore/QSharedMemory>
27#if QT_VERSION >= QT_VERSION_CHECK(5, 10, 0)
28#include <QtCore/QRandomGenerator>
29#else
30#include <QtCore/QDateTime>
31#endif
32
33#include "singleapplication.h"
34#include "singleapplication_p.h"
35
36/**
37 * @brief Constructor. Checks and fires up LocalServer or closes the program
38 * if another instance already exists
39 * @param argc
40 * @param argv
41 * @param {bool} allowSecondaryInstances
42 */
43SingleApplication::SingleApplication( int &argc, char *argv[], bool allowSecondary, Options options, int timeout )
44 : app_t( argc, argv ), d_ptr( new SingleApplicationPrivate( this ) )
45{
46 Q_D(SingleApplication);
47
48#if defined(Q_OS_ANDROID) || defined(Q_OS_IOS)
49 // On Android and iOS since the library is not supported fallback to
50 // standard QApplication behaviour by simply returning at this point.
51 qWarning() << "SingleApplication is not supported on Android and iOS systems.";
52 return;
53#endif
54
55 // Store the current mode of the program
56 d->options = options;
57
58 // Generating an application ID used for identifying the shared memory
59 // block and QLocalServer
60 d->genBlockServerName();
61
62#ifdef Q_OS_UNIX
63 // By explicitly attaching it and then deleting it we make sure that the
64 // memory is deleted even after the process has crashed on Unix.
65 d->memory = new QSharedMemory( d->blockServerName );
66 d->memory->attach();
67 delete d->memory;
68#endif
69 // Guarantee thread safe behaviour with a shared memory block.
70 d->memory = new QSharedMemory( d->blockServerName );
71
72 // Create a shared memory block
73 if( d->memory->create( sizeof( InstancesInfo ) ) ) {
74 // Initialize the shared memory block
75 d->memory->lock();
76 d->initializeMemoryBlock();
77 d->memory->unlock();
78 } else {
79 // Attempt to attach to the memory segment
80 if( ! d->memory->attach() ) {
81 qCritical() << "SingleApplication: Unable to attach to shared memory block.";
82 qCritical() << d->memory->errorString();
83 delete d;
84 ::exit( EXIT_FAILURE );
85 }
86 }
87
88 auto *inst = static_cast<InstancesInfo*>( d->memory->data() );
89 QElapsedTimer time;
90 time.start();
91
92 // Make sure the shared memory block is initialised and in consistent state
93 while( true ) {
94 d->memory->lock();
95
96 if( d->blockChecksum() == inst->checksum ) break;
97
98 if( time.elapsed() > 5000 ) {
99 qWarning() << "SingleApplication: Shared memory block has been in an inconsistent state from more than 5s. Assuming primary instance failure.";
100 d->initializeMemoryBlock();
101 }
102
103 d->memory->unlock();
104
105 // Random sleep here limits the probability of a collision between two racing apps
106#if QT_VERSION >= QT_VERSION_CHECK(5, 10, 0)
107 QThread::sleep( QRandomGenerator::global()->bounded( 8u, 18u ) );
108#else
109 qsrand( QDateTime::currentMSecsSinceEpoch() % std::numeric_limits<uint>::max() );
110 QThread::sleep( 8 + static_cast <unsigned long>( static_cast <float>( qrand() ) / RAND_MAX * 10 ) );
111#endif
112 }
113
114 if( inst->primary == false) {
115 d->startPrimary();
116 d->memory->unlock();
117 return;
118 }
119
120 // Check if another instance can be started
121 if( allowSecondary ) {
122 inst->secondary += 1;
123 inst->checksum = d->blockChecksum();
124 d->instanceNumber = inst->secondary;
125 d->startSecondary();
126 if( d->options & Mode::SecondaryNotification ) {
127 d->connectToPrimary( timeout, SingleApplicationPrivate::SecondaryInstance );
128 }
129 d->memory->unlock();
130 return;
131 }
132
133 d->memory->unlock();
134
135 d->connectToPrimary( timeout, SingleApplicationPrivate::NewInstance );
136
137 delete d;
138
139 ::exit( EXIT_SUCCESS );
140}
141
142/**
143 * @brief Destructor
144 */
145SingleApplication::~SingleApplication()
146{
147 Q_D(SingleApplication);
148 delete d;
149}
150
151bool SingleApplication::isPrimary()
152{
153 Q_D(SingleApplication);
154 return d->server != nullptr;
155}
156
157bool SingleApplication::isSecondary()
158{
159 Q_D(SingleApplication);
160 return d->server == nullptr;
161}
162
163quint32 SingleApplication::instanceId()
164{
165 Q_D(SingleApplication);
166 return d->instanceNumber;
167}
168
169qint64 SingleApplication::primaryPid()
170{
171 Q_D(SingleApplication);
172 return d->primaryPid();
173}
174
175QString SingleApplication::primaryUser()
176{
177 Q_D(SingleApplication);
178 return d->primaryUser();
179}
180
181QString SingleApplication::currentUser()
182{
183 Q_D(SingleApplication);
184 return d->getUsername();
185}
186
187bool SingleApplication::sendMessage( const QByteArray &message, int timeout )
188{
189 Q_D(SingleApplication);
190
191 // Nobody to connect to
192 if( isPrimary() ) return false;
193
194 // Make sure the socket is connected
195 d->connectToPrimary( timeout, SingleApplicationPrivate::Reconnect );
196
197 d->socket->write( message );
198 bool dataWritten = d->socket->waitForBytesWritten( timeout );
199 d->socket->flush();
200 return dataWritten;
201}
